These are the values of constants calculated using Hamop library and are used in it. If you are using Hamop for precision above 3000 digits you should recalculate these values and value of PI and e to the required precision.
when you enter a number greater than 3000 in the text box of 'Maximum no. of digits' the program will automatically start to calculate these values,(It will not store the calculated values) it will take hours to complete. Instead you should calculate it one by one and store it in its place in cVlNums class. I have mentioned the run time i obtained when i calculated e & PI in my laptop in the respective files.(These constants should be calculated in the order as in the UpdateConstants() sub in VLnMath class)
If you intent to use only the basic arithmetic operations(+,-,*,/) above 3000 digits(any no. of digits) you can comment out the line "If _MaxLength > ConstantsLen Then Call VLnMath.UpdateConstants()" in MaximumLength property. and use it.
